Comments: What needs to be said? 190+ inning super stud for the last two seasons, only Skenes and Crochet compare.
A clear top 3 SP. The only problem is the lack of wins, which makes a big difference in standard roto value. But he's the best ERA pitcher in the game, we can't complain too much.
Some of the best stuff in the league and he fixed his walk issue last year. Some ERA bloating may occur with the higher HR/9, but the WHIP and strikeouts will be elite
No questions about his dominance, just needs to stay healthy

He hasn't given us any reason to doubt the skills, but he'll be 37 and did not stay healthy last year. It's a risky pick, but you can't let him slide very far down the list. He's a top ten arm in the league when healthy.
Did not pitch quite like a Cy Young, and you still have to worry about the injuries, but he's in a good spot to log another 27+ starts

Broken elbow last year, but at least it wasn't a ligament thing, and he probably would have returned if the Braves were in contention. Great numbers across the board, high-floor, high-ceiling pitcher.

Did everything we thought he would last year. The HR issue keeps the ERA above three, which limits the ceiling a little bit, but the WHIP and strikeouts and stability are great. Strong SP2 option for 2026.
Slight concern about innings (150?) and homers (1.3 HR/9), but the strikeouts and WHIP will be elite. Per-start SP1 upside for sure.
Volume monster, very solid pitcher. I suspect the K% will drop back down to 22%, and the ratios are usually nothing special. He's very league-specific.
Crazy upside. He looks like one of the best pitchers in the league, but can he stay on the mound? Probably capped around 140 innings.
I think 2025 was a career year for him. I've got the K% losing a couple points and the BB% going up a point. Could be more like an SP3 at an SP1 price tag.
Awesome numbers from 2024-2025 before and after the surgery. Looked great in late 2025 after returning, finished healthy. I have some questions about the fastball and his durability though.
Elite fastball, elite walk rate in his short time in the Majors. Great durability (so far), good GB%. The sky is the limit, and we have to consider the SP1 upside he has when ranking him.

K-BB% dropped to 17%, he's lost K% for two straight years now. HR issues, not great vs. LHB, getting older. Was very lucky to post a strong ERA last year. Lots of arrows pointing down here, but I think he's a fine SP3-SP4 option.

If he doesn't get the velo and command back, I don't know if he can be very good. 2025 was pretty discouraging. The bet would be on him needing this offseason of recovery and returning in 2026 much closer to his 2023-2024 form. But I don't know if we ever get that Strider again.
He was very "lucky" in 2025, but a lot of that shouldn't be shocking. Career 9% HR/FB, great fastball and changeup, great command. Overperformance in 2025 aside, he's a solid arm in a good park.
Relies on soft contact and doesn't have a great breaking ball, but pinpoint command with high efficiency.
The injury concerns are less this year. Solid fastball, strong curveball and changeup. High floor when pitching, but it feels like a bit of buy high with the 2026 ADP
Maybe I'm too low, but I'm a bit worried about his K% ability when seeing the pitch mix, and his command has never been anything great
Going back to the Trop will work wonders for Pepiot. Ceiling is limited by a lack of a great secondary pitch, but I think the floor is fantastic.

Maybe he'll never put it all together. Consistency has been a huge issue. But he showed the ceiling in April-May of last year and holds onto a high career K%. I think there's some hope, and I imagine he'll be pretty cheap in 2026.
It's really just a question of health. Lots of injuries the last few years and finished the year hurt. Non-dominant stuff, but he's a good pitcher
Bad luck and rust crushed his first half, but he was his normal self again over the last 15 starts. Solid value this year, but no true upside any longer at age 30 with a proven mediocre K%.
Has not found consistency or health in the Majors, and now he's pretty old. But there's strikeout and ERA upside with the forkball he has.

Very strong fastball + changeup foundation. Was impressive in his first year as a full-time starter after being a Rule V pick. Needs to lower the BB% a touch, but it's a solid profile. High upside arm.
Good pitcher, no doubt, but a ticking time bomb with the age and all of these injuries from 2025
Added a sinker, which could lower the ERA, but his K% (24%) and BB% (11%) have always been trouble in his MLB career. Big guy, good stuff... but overall he's not going to be anything special

Was crushed by a 2.0 HR/9 at home last year. Park shift will help. Good fastball, deep arsenal. I think he's a solid floor arm with a little bit of upside if the K% can tick up a bit more with the velo.
Better K-BB% stuff than you'd think, but a constant HR issue and inconsistencies. But he's a reliable 150+ strikeout bet.
He's going to go for a higher HR/FB some year and it will be a disaster. But you can't fully deny the success he's had.

The K% and BB% are there, he just keeps giving up a ton of tanks. I'd rather buy than sell on the guy, but he doesn't seem like a guy who will put up a great-looking ERA until he tames down the FB% a bit.
The fastballs were a disaster in 2025 and that hung him out to dry. It's not a pretty picture, but the success he had in 2023-2024 make me want to think he can bounce back a bit.

Had some success in the Majors, stayed healthy and threw 130 innings. Elite changeup with some potential in the fastball. Needs to improve with the heater, but if he does, he could be quite effective.
Great fastball, but very high usage on it. Not a great putaway pitch. Solid floor pitcher though with that great heater.

He introduced a new splitter and dominated late in the year when he started using it more. Pretty enticing guy for 2026 at the cost. But that's putting most of your chips on the splitter truly being a difference-maker.

Need clarity on what the Pirates do with their rotation, but Ashcraft could be a pretty solid arm for them. Maybe not a great fantasy option with a lower K%, but he's interesting. Love the SwStr% and GB% combo.
Cut five points off the BB%, but threw changeups and curves 50% of the time. His sinker was awful. I predict that BB% will be 10% again and he'll go back to mostly his old ways. Fade!
Fastballs are a real problem, and he's not been able to stay healthy. But he has two elite secondaries, and that gives him some upside on any given week
Fastballs stinks, low velo. But deep pitch mix and non-awful command. Could turn into a solid innings-eater, and it's a good park for him
Projections will like him to bounce-back a little bit, but he's a middling pitcher at best. I'd rather shoot for upside late in the draft than take a guy who we're pretty sure will be an ERA drain.
Good signs early in his career, seems like a tough dude to hit, but you never know. His velo is middling and there's no great pitch. Low ceiling.

His HR issues and low K% really limit his fantasy ceiling even if he does bounce back to 2023-2024 form. And we saw how bad it can go with him in 2025. I don't see much reason to draft him, but it's reasonable to think you can get a 125 strikeout season with a 1.10 WHIP next year if he's healthy.
His SwStr% + Ball% + GB% trio were elite. Great fastball and curveball with a sinker/change behind it. Was very unlucky last year. Health pointing upward. Breakout season is coming.
Big fastball, bad command. Plenty of upside if he can refine himself a bit, and he went above 150 innings last year. Some reasons for optimism.
Fastball sucks still, but the splitter was good enough to keep him about a league average arm
Bad ratios are guaranteed! But he does not allow homers with his 66% GB%. Points league option, maybe? But he's bad.
Way too reliant on the splitter. His fastballs are terrible, and he's had bad command his entire career. No thanks!
Known commodity at this point. Good for QS, but not great at anything and mostly a negativ over a full season. Reserve for super deep leagues and streaming.
Questions about when he'll be up and how he'll transition, but he's ready for the MLB and the numbers last year were elite!
Finished strong with the K%, but was hurt a lot, and he's never thrown enough strikes. There's non-zero upside with him at his age with the fastball he has, but overall it's a thumbs-down.
Had a good K% and BB% last year, but it seemed a little bit lucky with a low SwStr%. He's also a heavy FB% guy, which is very bad vs. RHB in that home park.

Not a lock for the rotation by any means, but is the only considerable lefty they have. Pretty nasty left-handed sinker with a split and slider. High upside arm, I'd say. But hard to draft while we don't know where he'll pitch.
Fastball velo sucks, seems pretty dependent on the changeup. His K% will regress as a starter, I don't see much reason for hope.
Exciting arm, could have a very good career. But returning from TJ this year makes you doubt the volume and even some of the early performance. Decent IL stash to start the year.
IL stash only. Could go to the bullpen, starting to seem like a longshot that he'll ever throw 100+ innings again.
Hasn't pitched in the MLB since August 2023. We'll have to wait for spring updates, but 130+ innings in the Majors seems almost impossible at this point.
He looks like a very good pitcher, but he has not stayed healthy and we have to wonder if he can throw 100+ innings as a starter
Successful volume season following TJ, but the K% came down and the BB% came up. Heavy fly baller, any further lost in "nastiness" could be very bad for him
Big leaguers had no trouble with his four-seamer, questionable if he makes the OD rotation
Highly unlikely he stays healthy. Bad fastball, was very lucky last year. But a good landing spot in SF!

Has some potential with the good fastball, but he needs to figure out how to not get hit so hard. History of bad walk rates and middling K%, I don't think there's much hope for him, but the change in scenery maybe makes a difference?
Wicked changeup, the fastball survives. He's held his own, but it's a super, super low ceiling.
Elite K-BB% after getting back from injury, but gave up a ton of homers. Limited pitch mix, a career of inconsistency, and age keep him ranked pretty low.
The fastball is good enough to hang around a big league rotation, but I think the ERA is going to be bad, and I think he's going to lose strikeouts.
Lots of pitches, doesn't have a walk issue. He just doesn't have a good fastball and has never exceeded 90 innings as a pro yet.
Could give you a decent ERA, but the WHIP will be bad and he's inefficient
Deep arsenal, can throw a bunch of pitches and limit walks, but none of the stuff is all that great
Will he start? Does he has the secondaries to make it an MLB starter? I'm kind of thinking that he doesn't
Wicked changeup but a really bad fastball. Workload questions, is he better off a a reliever?
Durability questions, bad fastball, low K% in the Majors so far
Low K%, no upside, probably bad ratios, old. But a nasty changeup.
Injury concerns w/ the elbow inflammation late. A history of bad command, not a good fastball.
The MiLB results give you pause, but I like the fastball and the arsenal depth. The park shift should change, and he shouldn't have trouble staying in the STL rotation
Nasty against lefties, but doesn't have it against righties. High GB% keeps him competitive, but he's not a good option for fantasy leagues.
Has a rotation spot with the Cardinals
Good velo, but bad results. Not a deep pitch mix. Feels more like a reliever to me. But the heavy fastball and lack of option options in the org gives me a sliver of hope.
Horrible fastball, 33 years old, and the park doesn't fit his style. The changeup keeps him in some games, but it's a very thin fantasy profile.
He was awful last year. The sinker losing velo is a killer, and he's never had great secondaries.
This could be a moot point if he ends up as a middle reliever. But he can get a bunch of whiffs. Maybe even turns into the closer?
Seems like an SP4 type at best. Good fastball but nothing behind it. Questionable if he's even in the Astros rotation.
Ran hot in HR/FB and turned in a non-awful season, but there's no ceiling whatsoever and a very low floor if he starts giving up homers
Things got better with Tampa, but not enough. Can't locate the fastball, probably headed for a bullpen role.
It will be August by the time he's built up, it's fine as a free IL stash, but that's it
10 bad pitches! That's impressive. No upside, but probably 120+ not completely terrible innings?
Should be able to get some volume, but there are no indicators from the minors that he'll be any good
Sadly, just doesn't seem to have the goods. K% dropped under 20%, SwStr% under 11%, has never been able to get lefties out.
If he gets the command back, he'll be interesting. But he could not throw a strike last year.
Everything looks good, it's just a question of when/if he gets called up in 2026
When does he get into the MLB rotation? Can he continue to limit homers like he has in the past? There's no ceiling, so that takes him out of standard league talk.
I guess the Astros will have to use him, but he's like a 22% K% guy max with no command, and the stuff models don't like his pitches either
No fastball. Only one good pitch, bad command. Seems like he should be a reliever.
Overperformed early and his true colors were revealed late. He's not good, but he will pitch as many innings as he can handle
Low, low K%, but sinker + changeup will keep the ball in the yard in SF
Super deep points leagues, there still has to be some hope that he can become a 150-strikeout guy? Maybe?
He's not going to be in the rotation initially, and his stuff doesn't look like he'll have much upside if he does
High strikeout rates, but not a starter's arsenal and the Giants have shown much confidence in him either.
Innings eater, lots of different pitches, but no hope for strikeouts. His stuff stinks.
He'll need to be way better than he ever has after recovering from TJ at age 28. I don't think that'll happen!
Will probably be in the rotation, but he's not good. Single-digit SwStr% with a home run problem.
Somewhat interesting sinker, but the ratios will be bad, and he's not at all guaranteed a spot.
8.6% SwStr%, has nothing other than a [mediocre] four-seamer
